thread.title: “Really Blue” Google Pixel launching in the UK on February 24
thread.title_full: “Really Blue” Google Pixel launching in the UK on February 24

author: Edgar Cervantes
title: “Really Blue” Google Pixel launching in the UK on February 24
text:
The Google Pixel proved to be a great contender after getting an 8.9 score in our review, but the “Quite Black” and “Very Silver” colors it originally launched in may not be your cup of tea. Looking for something bolder? Take a look at the new “Really Blue” version, which we have seen launched in the US and Canada already. We now know this blue edition will launch in the UK.
For all intents and purposes, this is pretty much the same Google Pixel you already know and love… except blue. Those who want to learn more about the phone can read our reviews on it, but be sure it is a great phone with great specs. These include a Qualcomm Snapdragon 821 processor, 4 GB of RAM, a 5-inch 1080p screen, a 2,770 mAh battery and plenty of other great features. But likely the most exciting factor regarding this phone is the peace of mind you will get from being among the first to get updates and new Android software.
Google Pixel XL review: a Pixel’s perspective Google Pixel review: a technical deep dive Interested? UK residents will be able to get the “Really Blue” Google Pixel starting February 24. This is a limited edition color, though, so interested customers should sign up before stock begins to run out. Pre-orders open up on February 17, so you might as well put your name to one now.
Prices vary depending on your plan and monthly payments, but you could get it for free, depending on your choice of service. Go ahead and check out EE and Carphone Warehouse for all the details. Is anyone signing up?
Buy the Really Blue Google Pixel from Carphone Warehouse
